Description: Mould-made pottery lamp with a double-convex body, a wide filling-hole surrounded by a double-ridged border, and a leaf-shaped lug handle on each side, the right one pierced. The raised base is slightly concave below. The nozzle has a small rounded end, and is decorated on top with a bull's head, the horns of which embrace the front half of the filling-hole. The other side of the filling-hole has a semi-circle of impressed ovules. Covered with a brown slip, burnt to dark grey and black.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q544)
